definition: to begin/to initiate/to inaugurate/to start/to create
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip

sentences.english: And the glass cannula was more suitable than adhesive bandages for enswathement .
sentences.chinese: 玻璃套管法包扎的效果较创可贴法为好且更为简便。

sentences.english: Mainly for medical permeating and drying of stripe medicine such as band-aid infusion band .
sentences.chinese: 主要用于创可贴，输液贴的药条浸药，烘干。

sentences.english: It could stick to your skin like you would attach a Band-Aid.
sentences.chinese: 它可以像邦迪创可贴一样直接粘在皮肤上。

sentences.english: Susie held her hand out shyly. In it was a Ban-Aid.
sentences.chinese: 苏茜害羞地伸出了手，手中是一片创可贴。

sentences.english: I resolved to proceed without the Bandaids.
sentences.chinese: 我决定不要创可贴，继续前行。

sentences.english: Not deep and no much blood out. Suggest you use some band-aid .
sentences.chinese: 您的伤口不深，流血也不多，我建议您使用创可贴吧。

sentences.english: There are Band-Aids in the medicine cabinet.
You need to put a bandage on the cut.
sentences.chinese: 你需要在切口处贴上创可贴。

sentences.english: But if I went back for the Bandaids I would have to endure the contempt of my acquaintances.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果我回去拿创可贴，就得忍受熟人们的蔑视。

sentences.english: Like a Band-Aid, just rip it off.
sentences.chinese: 就像撕下创可贴一样，照直做吧。

definition: variant of 棉籤|棉签[mian2 qian1]/cotton swab
herbal plaster applied to a wound
